medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset of epigastric pain and severe bloating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 30 minutes after eating pizza dough, experienced epigastric pain, severe wave-like pain, and bloating. This was associated with nausea and dry heaves but without vomiting. Patient confirmed fever at home and shaking chills, with a duration of 2 days before presenting to the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gallstones, asthma, MRSA infection; history of gallbladder issues.
medical_history.family_history: No significant family history for gallstones.
